alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 19 at 3:17PM HST until January 20 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A west-northwest swell will peak early tonight, then gradually diminish Thursday and Thursday night. A larger warning level swell is expected to arrive on Friday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Surf ranging from 12 to 16 feet along north facing shores, and surf between 6 to 12 feet along the west facing shores, except 6 to 8 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai, north facing shores of Maui, and west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution. Know your limits and seek ocean recreation areas best suited for your abilities.
